description: Unclear, possibly from settle (“seat, long bench”) +‎ -ee (diminutive suffix).

entries.meaning: (UK) A long seat with a back, made to accommodate several persons at once; a sofa.
examples: The lounge was furnished in old English oak and big Knole settees. There were rugs from Tabriz and Kerman on the highly polished floor.  […]  A table lamp was fashioned from a silver Egyptian hookah.

entries.meaning: A vessel with a very long, sharp prow, carrying two or three masts with lateen sails, used in the Mediterranean.
